title: How to Bet on Horse Racing with Crypto
body: Horse racing remains one of the oldest and most strategic forms of sports betting, combining statistical analysis, timing, and market knowledge. In 2026, the way bettors place wagers on races has evolved, with cryptocurrencies becoming an increasingly popular payment option. This guide explains how to bet on horse racing with crypto , from choosing the right platform to understanding odds, markets, and payouts. Whether you are new to racing or transitioning from traditional betting, crypto brings speed, flexibility, and global access to an otherwise traditional betting market. What Is Horse Racing Crypto Betting? Horse racing crypto betting allows players to place wagers on races using cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, or stablecoins instead of fiat money. The betting mechanics remain the same — only the payment layer changes. With horse racing betting with crypto, deposits are made directly from a crypto wallet, bets are placed on available race markets, and winnings are withdrawn back to the wallet without involving banks or card processors. This approach appeals to bettors who value faster payouts and fewer payment restrictions. Why Use Crypto for Horse Racing Bets Crypto has proven to be a natural fit for horse racing wagering for several reasons: Speed: Crypto deposits are typically instant, and withdrawals are often processed faster than traditional banking methods. Global access: Bettors can access races from different countries without worrying about local banking limitations. Payment independence: No cards, chargebacks, or third-party payment blocks. Control: Funds remain under the bettor’s control until placed on a wager. These advantages have driven steady growth in horse racing crypto betting, particularly among experienced bettors who value efficiency. How to Bet on Horse Racing with Crypto: Step-by-Step Step 1: Choose a Crypto Betting Platform The first step is selecting a platform that supports horse racing and crypto payments. Look for clear betting rules, transparent odds, and a solid reputation. Some platforms focus on decentralized or crypto-native infrastructure, while others adapt traditional racebooks to accept digital assets. Step 2: Deposit Crypto After registration, deposit your preferred cryptocurrency into your betting account. Most platforms provide a wallet address or QR code. Always double-check the network and address before sending funds. Step 3: Select a Race and Market Browse available races by region, track, or start time. Once you select a race, review the available betting markets and odds. Step 4: Place Your Bet Choose your stake, confirm the odds, and place the bet. Crypto platforms usually lock odds at the moment of confirmation, just like traditional sportsbooks. Step 5: Withdraw Winnings After the race is settled, winnings can be withdrawn back to your wallet. With crypto horse racing betting, payouts are typically processed much faster than bank-based methods. Popular Horse Racing Betting Markets Explained Horse racing offers a wide range of markets, making it attractive to both beginners and advanced bettors. Win: Your selected horse must finish first. Place: The horse must finish within the top positions (usually first or second). Show: The horse must finish in the top three. Each-way: A combination of win and place bets. Exacta: Picking the first two horses in the correct order. Trifecta: Picking the first three horses in exact order. Superfecta: Picking the first four finishers. Many platforms also offer live or in-play betting, allowing wagers to be placed as races approach the start. Using Dexsport for Horse Racing Crypto Betting Dexsport is a licensed, decentralized sportsbook and casino platform built specifically for crypto users who prioritize speed, privacy, and transparency. Launched in 2022, the platform operates under regulation from the Government of the Autonomous Island of Anjouan (Union of Comoros) and has positioned itself as a full Web3 betting ecosystem rather than a traditional sportsbook with crypto add-ons. One of Dexsport’s defining characteristics is its no-KYC approach. Players can register instantly using email, Telegram, or DeFi wallets such as MetaMask and Trust Wallet, without submitting personal documents. This makes the platform particularly attractive for bettors who want to place horse racing bets with crypto while maintaining full anonymity. Key Features of Dexsport Decentralized, crypto-native platform with on-chain transparency No identity verification required for registration or betting Over 40 supported cryptocurrencies across 20 blockchain networks Fast, fee-free deposits and withdrawals On-chain bet tracking, allowing wagers and outcomes to be verified publicly Cash Out feature available on in-play bets, enabling early profit locking or risk reduction Dexsport has also undergone smart contract audits by CertiK and Pessimistic and holds approvals from ECHELON, reinforcing its credibility within the global Web3 gaming ecosystem. Bonuses and Promotions on Dexsport Dexsport offers one of the most generous bonus structures in the crypto betting space, designed to reward both new and active users: Welcome Bonus: 480% bonus on the first three deposits (up to $10,000 total); 300 free spins for casino games Sports Betting Bonus: 60% in free bets across the first three deposits Weekly Cashback: Up to 15% cashback on losing bets, paid in stablecoins Sports Club Bonus: Monthly free bets for top bettors Event-Based Promotions: Special campaigns tied to major sporting events and blockchain launches Wagering requirements are transparent and vary by game type, allowing users to clearly understand bonus conditions before participating. Horse Racing and Betting Experience on Dexsport Dexsport’s fast processing and live betting infrastructure make it well-suited for time-sensitive markets such as horse racing. Bettors can place wagers quickly, monitor odds in real time, and use the Cash Out feature to manage positions before races conclude. The platform’s multi-chain support reduces delays caused by network congestion, while its crypto-only payment system ensures that payouts are not slowed down by banking procedures. Odds, Payouts, and Crypto Withdrawals Horse racing odds may be presented as fixed odds or through pari-mutuel systems, depending on the platform. Fixed odds lock in your payout when the bet is placed, while pari-mutuel payouts depend on the total betting pool. With online horse racing crypto betting, payouts are calculated automatically once results are finalized. Crypto withdrawals usually follow shortly after settlement, though processing times depend on platform approval systems and blockchain conditions. Safety Tips and Bankroll Management Horse racing can be unpredictable, making discipline essential: Set a clear bankroll and stick to it Avoid chasing losses across multiple races Start with simple markets before moving to exotic bets Test withdrawals with small amounts before scaling up Responsible bankroll management is just as important as selecting the right horses. Legal Considerations for Horse Racing Crypto Betting Regulations around horse racing and crypto betting vary by country. Some jurisdictions permit horse racing bets but restrict online gambling payments, while others allow offshore platforms to operate with limited oversight. Bettors should always understand local laws and use platforms responsibly. Crypto simplifies payments, but it does not remove the need to comply with regional regulations. Horse Racing Crypto Betting Trends in 2026 By 2026, several trends are shaping the market: Increased adoption of crypto-native racebooks Faster payout expectations as a standard Growth of mobile-first betting platforms Greater interest in global race coverage As technology improves, crypto is becoming a mainstream option rather than a niche alternative. Final Thoughts Horse racing remains a sport where timing, knowledge, and discipline play a decisive role — and crypto has only enhanced that experience. Faster payouts, global access, and direct wallet control have made crypto betting an increasingly attractive option for modern players. In 2026, crypto sportsbooks offer a practical alternative to traditional racebooks by removing banking friction and providing greater flexibility across betting markets. Platforms like Dexsport demonstrate how decentralized infrastructure, transparent operations, and competitive bonuses can improve the overall betting process. By choosing reliable crypto sportsbooks, understanding horse racing markets, and managing bankroll responsibly, bettors can take full advantage of what crypto-based horse racing betting has to offer — both now and in the years ahead.

title: Top AI Agents for Crypto Trading in 2026: Free & Paid Tools Reviewed
body: The crypto market operates 24/7 and creates opportunities for traders to make a profit. However, it is very volatile, and human traders can find it difficult to monitor and navigate continuously. AI crypto trading agents have become essential tools for trading in and navigating the crypto markets. They offer automated crypto trading strategies that respond to market movements faster than manually stacking up gains. The top AI trading bots in 2026 are trading software that can perform sentiment analysis, pattern recognition, and strategy optimization, going beyond simple automation. The market for free cryptocurrency trading bots has expanded dramatically, and professional traders managing large portfolios can now access sophisticated features through paid cryptocurrency AI tools. This guide examines both free crypto trading bot 2026 options and premium AI tools for crypto trading, providing detailed comparisons of AI crypto trading software to help you select the right automated crypto trading agents that suit your investment strategy. What Are AI Trading Agents? AI trading agents are software that use artificial intelligence to trade crypto with little or no human interaction. AI agents use algorithms and machine learning models to determine the best investment strategies based on market conditions, in contrast to traditional bots that trade according to a predetermined set of rules. The core technologies behind the best AI trading bots 2026 include the following: Machine Learning (ML) AI trading bots use ML to improve performance over time by learning from their previous performance, historical price data, trading volumes, and other market conditions. ML enables these trading bots to identify patterns that human technical analysis might miss. Natural Language Processing (NLP) NLP enables AI tools for crypto trading to analyze and understand social media , news articles, which will help it determine current market sentiments. According to some experts, trading strategies that include market sentiments often outperform other types of strategies by up to 18% in the crypto market. Reinforcement Learning This type of core tech helps automated crypto trading agents optimize decision-making by rewarding profitable trades and penalizing losses. This creates a system that helps the agent to continuously refine its trading strategy. How AI Agents Work in Crypto Markets It is important for traders to understand how AI crypto trading agents work to help them select the tools that best align with their trading goals and strategy. The best AI trading bots 2026 function through the following processes: Data Ingestion These paid crypto AI tools and free versions of crypto trading bots continuously collect information from multiple sources, including exchange price feeds, trading volumes, blockchain metrics, and social sentiment indicators. High-frequency data collection allows the AI tools for crypto trading to detect opportunities within milliseconds. Strategy Generation & Optimization Using machine learning algorithms, automated crypto trading agents identify profitable patterns and generate trading strategies. AI-driven cryptocurrency trading systems can process over a hundred thousand market signals simultaneously, far exceeding anything a regular human can do. Risk Management The best AI crypto trading bots implement dynamic position sizing, stop-loss automation, and portfolio rebalancing. Instead of using fixed position sizes when trading, these AI crypto trading software consider the market volatility and account balance to help reduce the risk of making large losses. Execution Timing By examining order flow, liquidity depth, and past volatility trends, AI cryptocurrency trading agents identify exact entry and exit points. When compared to manual trading, using AI bots to trade cryptocurrencies can greatly reduce slippage. Self-Learning Behavior In order to improve performance over time, the most sophisticated AI tools for cryptocurrency trading use reinforcement learning, modifying parameters according to which strategies yield the highest risk-adjusted returns. What To Consider Before Choosing an AI Trading Tool The following are the important factors to evaluate before making a choice out of the numerous AI crypto trading agents: Security & Custodial Access According to cybersecurity firm CipherTrace, over $300 million in cryptocurrency was stolen through compromised trading bot API keys. When connecting crypto trading bots, free or paid versions, to your exchange accounts, you should never expose your API keys. The best AI trading bots 2026 use read-only or trade-only permissions without withdrawal capabilities so even if your API keys are compromised, your money can’t be withdrawn. Always verify that AI crypto trading software employs encryption and two-factor authentication. Backtesting & Historical Performance Any AI tools for crypto trading that you can trust would allow you to look under the hood to transparent backtest results and assess how their automated crypto trading strategies stack up over time. As a general rule, be skeptical of platforms that claim consistently high monthly returns if you can’t verify them by yourself. Customizability vs Pre-Built Strategies Some AI crypto trading agents are beginner-friendly, offering plug-and-play strategies, while others allow experienced traders with technical knowledge to design and tweak their own strategies. The best trading bots provide a balance between ease of use and customizability, giving you an option to choose depending on your needs and requirements. Pricing Structure Some crypto trading bots offer a free tier, which often includes basic features with limitations on trading volume and complex strategies. Paid tools typically charge monthly subscriptions depending on features, performance, and customizability. Supported Exchanges Before choosing an AI crypto trading software, ensure that it works with the exchanges you use. Most automated crypto trading platforms support major exchanges like Binance, Coinbase , and Kraken. Community & Support An AI trading tool with a strong user community and reliable customer support can make a huge difference, especially when you need to debug or refine strategies. Free & Freemium AI Crypto Trading Agents (2026) These are the best free and freemium AI crypto trading agents in 2026 Pionex Type: AI-assisted grid and arbitrage bots. AI Level: Medium (strategy optimization + automation). Best For: Beginners who want to use AI agents to trade but don’t know how to code. Pricing: Free (exchange-based trading fees only). Pionex is a crypto exchange that offers about 16 pre-built crypto trading bots free to all users and a user-friendly interface. Its grid trading bot automatically buys low and sells high within specified price ranges, while its arbitrage bot exploits price differences between trading pairs. However, when compared with more advanced platforms, Pionex does not really stack up as well in terms of customization options due to limitations that come with its pre-built options. According to Pionex’s published statistics, users executed over $25 billion in trading volume. Pionex doesn’t charge any subscription fees, but there’s a 0.05% trading fee. This makes it one of the most affordable AI crypto trading software. Kryll Type: Visual AI strategy builder. AI Level: Medium-High (ML-assisted strategy optimization). Best For: Traders experimenting with no-code AI logic. Pricing: Freemium (limited strategy executions free, paid plans from $13/month). Kryll distinguishes itself among AI crypto trading agents through its visual strategy editor, allowing users to build automated crypto trading strategies using drag-and-drop logic blocks. The free tier permits limited monthly strategy executions, making it an accessible entry point for those exploring crypto trading bots’ free options before committing to paid crypto AI tools. Kryll supports over 15 major exchanges and maintains an active marketplace where users can purchase proven strategies from successful traders. Coinrule Type: Rule-based automation with AI signals. AI Level: Medium (Rule-based + AI signal). Best For: Retail traders automating basic strategies. Pricing: Free tier available, paid plans from $29.99/month. Coinrule combines traditional rule-based automation with AI-generated trading signals, positioning it as a hybrid among AI crypto trading software platforms. It has an intuitive UI featuring a rule builder, where users can create “if-then” rules (e.g., “if BTC drops 5%, buy $100”) while receiving AI-powered market insights. According to Coinrule’s 2025 transparency report, their AI tools for crypto trading processed over $2 billion in user trades across 10,000+ active accounts. Stoic AI Type: AI agent for portfolio management. AI Level: High (quantitative + ML models). Best For: Passive investors. Pricing: 1% fee on profits, Free through partner exchanges. Stoic operates as an independent portfolio manager that makes trades by looking at market conditions according to the assessments made by models created by seasoned fund managers . For traders who want to avoid paying any money upfront, Stoic’s cryptocurrency trading bots charge a 1% fee on profits instead of the standard subscription fees others charge. TradeSanta Type: Automated bots with AI signals. AI Level: Low-Medium. Best For: Entry-level automation. Pricing: Free trial, paid plans from $18/month. TradeSanta is one of the most beginner-friendly automated crypto trading agents. Its AI executes simple long and short strategies, focusing on dollar cost averaging (DCA) and grid trading strategies across over 15 crypto exchanges. Paid AI Crypto Trading Agents (Advanced / Pro) 3Commas Type: Advanced automation + AI signals. AI Level: Medium-High. Best For: Active traders and automation of portfolio management. Pricing: Plans from $49/month to $99/month. 3Commas is one of the best AI trading bots 2026 crypto traders can find. It is designed for serious traders, featuring advanced portfolio management tools and subscriptions to AI powered trading signals. The platform uses machine learning for its DCA and grid bots, which help traders find the best entry to purchase crypto and the optimal size. 3Commas is established as a top AI crypto trading software for active traders. It has over 150,000 users and about $10 billion in trading volume. It also has a marketplace where the most profitable traders can sell strategies for other users to copy. Bitsgap Type: AI-powered arbitrage & grid trading. AI Level: Medium (Automated strategy + arbitrage). Best for: Cross-exchange traders. Pricing: Paid plans. Traders go to Bitsgap for its promise of between 3%-8% monthly returns through arbitrage, providing users with grid trading strategies and arbitrage opportunities by scanning various exchanges for price differences. It also provides advanced portfolio tracking and currently supports about 25 crypto exchanges. Token Metrics Type: AI investment and trading intelligence agent. AI Level: High (Predictive AI models). Best For: Research-driven traders and funds. Pricing: Plans from $99/month to $499/month. Token Metrics takes a research-first approach to AI crypto trading. Instead of placing trades for you, it works as an intelligence gathering platform, which helps traders gather the necessary data they need to make informed trading decisions. The platform evaluates each crypto using over 100 data points, including market sentiments, to make forecasts and generate its own ratings. Token Metrics says its models can predict market moves with up to 70% accuracy. Numerai Signals Type: Crowdsourcing AI signal agent. AI Level: Very high (data science + ML). Best For: Quant-minded traders. Pricing: Free. Numerai Signals was launched in 2020 and operates as a crypto-focused hedge fund powered by a global community of data scientists, which makes it stand out from other AI crypto trading tools. Before committing to Numerai Signals, note that it doesn’t trade directly. Instead, it allows participants to stake crypto on their market conditions and earn rewards if those predictions perform well. In practice, Numerai Signals creates a decentralized competition where AI models and trading strategies are constantly tested against one another. According to Numerai Signals, the fund manages about $200 million in assets and has paid out about $50 million to the top performers. Autonio Type: AI agent marketplace + portfolio bots. AI Level: High. Best For: DeFi traders and advanced traders building AI-powered automation. Pricing: Subscription-based, pricing varies by features. Autonio blends AI crypto trading with DeFi , making it easy to automate trades on DeFi platforms, including centralized exchanges. It also offers a marketplace where developers publish their AI trading algorithms, which users can easily deploy. Autonio offers one of the most customizable experiences for traders who want to deploy custom strategies. It also supports market-making, arbitrage opportunities, and trend-following. It has a native crypto token, NIOX, which gives users access to premium features and reduced fees. Next-Gen / AI-Agent-Style Tools Fetch.ai Type: Autonomous on-chain AI agents. Use Case: Agent-to-agent trading and optimization. Fetch.ai pioneers autonomous trading agents that can negotiate, discover services, and execute transactions independently on blockchain networks. While not a traditional trading bot, Fetch.ai’s framework enables future scenarios where AI agents optimize trading strategies through peer-to-peer negotiation. The platform’s Autonomous Economic Agents (AEAs) can theoretically coordinate trading strategies, share liquidity information, and execute complex multi-step transactions without centralized coordination. SingularityNET Type: Modular AI agents. Use Case: Custom trading intelligence stacks. SingularityNET provides a decentralized marketplace for AI services, allowing traders to combine multiple specialized AI models into custom trading systems. Instead of offering pre-built bots, the platform enables the composition of sentiment analysis, price prediction, and risk management modules from different providers. This modular approach to AI tools for crypto trading allows sophisticated users to build custom automated crypto trading strategies tailored to specific market niches or trading styles. dHEDGE Type: AI-assisted on-chain fund strategies. Use Case: Copy AI-driven traders. dHEDGE is a decentralized asset management protocol that traders can use AI to modify their trading strategies and deploy capital to the most profitable trades. The platform reports processing about $100 million in total value locked across various strategies. Because it operates on the blockchain, it adds the extra perk of being a transparent marketplace for AI crypto trading software.

title: Best Horse Racing Crypto Betting Sites in 2026 — Platforms Built for Fast Markets
body: Horse racing has always occupied a unique position in the betting world. Unlike most team sports, races are short, markets move quickly, and betting volume concentrates in narrow time windows just before the start. By 2026, this dynamic has made horse racing one of the most demanding sports for online betting platforms. As traditional racebooks continue to rely on banking systems and regional restrictions, many bettors are shifting toward horse racing crypto betting online . Crypto-based platforms offer faster access to markets, direct wallet payments, and fewer interruptions during peak betting moments. This article explores which crypto betting sites are best suited for horse racing in 2026 and what makes a platform truly capable of handling fast-moving race markets. How Horse Racing Betting Markets Differ From Other Sports Horse racing betting operates under a fundamentally different structure than football, basketball, or tennis. Races are frequent, often overlapping across tracks and countries, and most betting activity happens minutes — sometimes seconds — before the race begins. Another key difference is market variety. While many sports focus on spreads and totals, horse racing relies heavily on outcome-based and combination bets. This creates complex pricing dynamics and requires platforms to handle rapid odds updates without freezing markets or delaying bet execution. Because of this structure, horse racing betting with crypto has gained traction among bettors who need uninterrupted access to markets and quick settlement after results are finalized. Crypto-native platforms are often better equipped to support multiple tracks, international race cards, and high-frequency betting activity without the bottlenecks seen on traditional racebooks. In the next section, we’ll break down what specifically makes a horse racing crypto betting site suitable for fast markets — and why not all crypto sportsbooks meet those standards. What Makes a Crypto Horse Racing Betting Site Ideal in 2026 Not every crypto sportsbook is built to handle horse racing efficiently. While many platforms technically offer racing markets, only a smaller group is truly optimized for the fast, high-turnover nature of the sport. In 2026, bettors look beyond basic crypto support. The real difference lies in how a platform performs under pressure — especially in the minutes leading up to post time. A strong horse racing crypto betting site typically shares several key characteristics. Stable market execution close to race start, without frequent suspensions Rapid odds updates that reflect late money flows accurately Support for multiple tracks and regions, often running simultaneously Quick bet confirmation, even during peak traffic Fast settlement once results are official These factors matter more in horse racing than in most other sports. A delay of a few seconds can mean missed odds or rejected wagers, particularly for bettors targeting value late in the market. Another important aspect is platform flexibility. Horse racing bettors often place a mix of simple and complex bets within a short time frame. Platforms that struggle with combination wagers or restrict certain bet types close to the start quickly lose relevance. This is where horse racing crypto betting sites tend to outperform traditional racebooks. Crypto-native infrastructure allows platforms to process deposits, wagers, and withdrawals without relying on banking intermediaries — reducing friction during the busiest moments of the betting cycle. In short, the ideal platform in 2026 is not just one that accepts crypto, but one that is structurally designed for fast-moving racing markets. Best Horse Racing Crypto Betting Sites in 2026 Not all crypto betting platforms are equally suited for horse racing. Some excel at fast execution and late market access, while others focus on broader sportsbook coverage with racing included as an add-on. Below are crypto platforms that stand out in 2026 for their ability to handle fast-moving horse racing markets, reliable payouts, and overall usability. Dexsport — Built for Fast Crypto Betting Markets Dexsport stands out as a platform designed from the ground up for speed, transparency, and uninterrupted betting. Rather than adapting traditional sportsbook infrastructure, it operates as a crypto-native ecosystem — a key advantage for horse racing. Race markets benefit from quick bet confirmation and minimal friction close to post time. The platform’s decentralized architecture allows bettors to enter and exit positions without relying on banking systems or delayed approvals. Key strengths for horse racing bettors include: Crypto-only deposits and withdrawals across multiple networks No mandatory KYC for registration or betting Fast market access during peak race windows Cash-out functionality for in-play risk management On-chain transparency for wager verification For bettors who focus on timing and execution rather than bonus chasing, Dexsport fits naturally into a fast-market betting strategy. Lucky Block — Crypto Platform With Broad Sports Focus Lucky Block approaches betting as part of a wider crypto ecosystem, combining sportsbook, casino, and esports under one interface. Its visual design is modern and performance-oriented, and payouts are often processed within minutes. The platform supports a wide range of cryptocurrencies and offers very low minimum deposits, which makes it accessible to casual users. From a racing perspective, Lucky Block is more suitable for bettors who mix horse racing with other sports rather than focusing exclusively on race markets. Pros worth noting: Wide crypto support and near-instant payouts Large welcome bonus and frequent promotion Simple onboarding, including wallet-based access However, horse racing markets are not always as deep or consistently available as on specialized racebooks. Some users also report account checks during withdrawals, which can slow down access to funds during busy periods. BetOnline — Traditional Racebook With Crypto Support BetOnline is one of the most established offshore sportsbooks still active in 2026. Its racebook offering is integrated alongside sports betting, casino games, and poker, creating an all-in-one environment. For horse racing bettors, BetOnline provides familiarity. Markets are clearly structured, race listings are extensive, and crypto payments are supported alongside fiat options. What BetOnline does well: Strong racebook experience with multiple tracks Early lines and consistent market availability Crypto withdrawals that are faster than many legacy platforms That said, the interface feels dated compared to newer crypto-native sites, and identity verification may be required for larger withdrawals. BetOnline suits bettors who prefer a traditional betting flow with the added convenience of crypto payments. BetNow — Straightforward Crypto Horse Racing Betting BetNow focuses on simplicity. Its platform is built for casual and mid-level bettors who want quick access to betting markets without advanced tools or complex layouts. Horse racing is offered as part of a broader sportsbook and casino setup. Markets cover the basics, and crypto deposits and withdrawals are supported with relatively low entry requirements. Key characteristics include: Beginner-friendly interface Integrated racebook alongside major sports Fast crypto payouts for most users The trade-off is depth. Live betting options and advanced race analytics are limited, and bonus wagering requirements can be higher than average. BetNow works best for bettors who place occasional race bets rather than high-frequency strategies. Each of these platforms serves a slightly different type of bettor. Some prioritize speed and market access, others value familiarity or low entry barriers. Understanding these differences is essential when choosing among horse racing crypto betting sites built for fast markets. How Blockchain Improves Horse Racing Betting Blockchain technology has quietly reshaped how horse racing bets are placed and settled. While the core of the sport remains unchanged, the infrastructure behind betting has become faster, more transparent, and less dependent on intermediaries. One of the biggest improvements is execution. Crypto-based platforms process wagers directly, without routing payments through banks or card networks. This reduces delays, especially in the narrow time window before post time when markets are most active. Another major shift is transparency. On crypto-native platforms, transactions and bet records are easier to track and verify. This adds confidence in markets where timing and accuracy are critical. Blockchain-driven betting also improves global access. Horse racing runs nearly around the clock, across different regions and time zones. Crypto platforms make it easier to access international tracks without worrying about local banking restrictions or currency conversions. In practical terms, blockchain improves horse racing betting by offering: Faster bet confirmation near race start Quicker settlement once results are official Reduced reliance on third-party payment providers Greater consistency during high-traffic periods These advantages are especially noticeable for bettors focused on fast markets rather than long-term futures. Tips for Betting on Fast Crypto Horse Racing Markets Speed alone does not guarantee success. Horse racing remains one of the most volatile betting environments, and fast execution must be paired with discipline and preparation. One of the simplest rules is timing. Markets often move sharply in the final minutes before a race. Being able to place a bet quickly matters, but so does knowing when not to chase shifting odds. A few practical tips help manage fast-market conditions: Place test bets early to understand how a platform behaves near post time Focus on markets you understand rather than spreading stakes across too many races Avoid platforms that frequently suspend markets before the start Keep bet sizes consistent to reduce emotional decisions Another important consideration is withdrawals. Before committing larger amounts, test the payout process with a small win. Platforms built for fast markets should handle withdrawals with the same efficiency as deposits. Finally, remember that fast markets reward preparation. Bettors who approach races with a clear plan tend to perform better than those reacting late to odds movement. What to Avoid on Crypto Horse Racing Betting Sites Not every platform that offers crypto betting is suited for horse racing. Some issues only become visible once real money is on the line — often at the worst possible moment, right before a race goes off. One common problem is market freezing. Certain platforms suspend betting too early, especially when liquidity spikes. This makes it difficult to react to late information or odds movement. Another red flag is inconsistent execution. If bets take several seconds to confirm — or worse, fail altogether — the platform is not built for fast markets. Things worth watching out for include: Frequent market suspensions close to post time Slow or unreliable bet confirmation Hidden withdrawal checks triggered after wins Poor coverage of international tracks Vague rules around bet settlement Bonus structures can also be misleading. Aggressive promotions sometimes come with restrictive wagering requirements that limit flexibility on horse racing markets. For anyone serious about horse racing crypto betting online, avoiding these pitfalls is just as important as choosing the right odds. Final Thoughts Horse racing is one of the most demanding betting environments in the world. Markets move fast, margins are thin, and timing often determines the difference between value and missed opportunity. In 2026, horse racing betting with crypto has become a practical solution for bettors who need speed, flexibility, and uninterrupted market access. Crypto-native platforms remove banking friction and are better equipped to handle the rapid pace of race betting. The best horse racing crypto betting sites are not defined by flashy promotions alone, but by execution quality, reliability near post time, and fast settlements once races are decided. Platforms built for fast markets — like Dexsport — reflect this shift toward efficiency-first betting. By understanding how racing markets work, choosing the right platform, and avoiding structural weak points, bettors can navigate horse racing crypto betting sites with greater confidence and control.

title: Bitcoin Price Still Has Room To Fall Below $60K — Crypto CEO
body: The Bitcoin price had a relatively rough trading period over the past week, as it hovered around the psychological $90,000 mark. The flagship cryptocurrency, which looked set for a return to six-figure valuation barely over a week ago, now seems to have lost all its bullish momentum. Broadly speaking, these recent struggles put to rest questions around the “relief rallies” to the upside, and correlate more with the current bear market structure. However, the latest on-chain evaluation shows that the Bitcoin price woes could worsen from here on out. Expert Explains Why $60,000 Is Possible For BTC Price In a recent post on the X platform, Alphractal CEO and founder Joao Wedson said that the Bitcoin price could still have room to fall below the $60,000 level. This not-so-optimistic prediction is based on the number of days Bitcoin has traded at prices higher than today. Related Reading: Bitcoin Supply In Profit Stalls At 71%: Still Not Enough For A Sustainable Recovery According to Wedson, there have been 355 days when the Bitcoin price has traded at levels higher than today. This figure was derived from the “Days Spent at a Profit” metric, which tracks the number of days in Bitcoin’s history where the market price was higher than the current price. This indicator measures how much price action — in the past — has occurred above the current price level. From a historical standpoint, an increase in the number of “Days Spent at a Profit” tends to occur during bear cycles or extended periods of sideways movement, implying that different investor groups are holding BTC at a price higher than their cost bases. As Wedson highlighted, the “Days Spent at a Profit” metric reached around 775 days as the Bitcoin price approached a bottom. Going by this historical context, the current level of this indicator (355 days) suggests that the flagship cryptocurrency is still a distance away from extreme levels often associated with bearish market bottoms. Ultimately, this deduction means that the price of Bitcoin could still be at risk of an extended decline over the next 300 days. According to the Alphractal, this extended period of price decline could see BTC revisit $60,000, potentially triggering significant liquidations among retail investors and institutional players who entered the market post-ETF. Bitcoin Price At A Glance As of this writing, the price of BTC stands at around $89,900, reflecting no significant change in the past 24 hours. However, the market leader is currently down by over 5% on the weekly timeframe, while nearly 30% adrift its all-time high of $126,080. Related Reading: Can Bitcoin Revisit $97,600? title: More Traders Are Betting Against XRP On Binance. Here’s What It Means
body: XRP’s funding rates on Binance have turned negative, indicating that more traders are currently betting against the asset. This development points to a market setup that could trigger significant short-term movements if buying pressure increases. Crypto commentator Xaif (@XaifCrypto) drew attention to this trend with a chart showing the funding rates alongside XRP’s USD price. XRP funding rates on Binance are negative. That means more traders are betting against XRP (shorts). When too many people short, even a small move up can force them to close. This often leads to a bounce or short squeeze. Keep an eye on it. $XRP pic.twitter.com/GsHJeWZENI — Xaif Crypto| (@Xaif_Crypto) January 22, 2026 XRP’s Negative Funding Rates The chart shows periods where funding rates dip below zero, signaling that short positions dominate the market. Xaif noted, “That means more traders are betting against XRP (shorts).” Negative funding rates suggest that traders who hold long positions receive payments from short sellers, reflecting the cost of borrowing XRP to maintain short positions. The chart shows multiple clusters of negative funding rates over the last several months. These areas, particularly those in mid-2025 and late 2025 into early 2026, demonstrate heightened short-term activity. Historically, when short positions accumulate to this degree, even modest upward price movements can force traders to close their positions, creating a rapid price rebound . XRP Price Response to Market Pressure The chart links funding rate trends with XRP’s price movements. While XRP sometimes showed consolidation, spikes in funding rate activity correspond with notable price surges. XRP showed this activity in late 2024 before the 500% rally and in mid-2025 before its run to a new all-time high . When the market faces an excess of shorts, any buying pressure can accelerate upward price movements. Xaif emphasized this dynamic, noting, “When too many people short, even a small move up can force them to close. This often leads to a bounce or short squeeze.” We are on X, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 — TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) June 15, 2025 Short Squeeze Potential The current negative funding rates suggest that XRP could be positioned for that short squeeze . Traders holding short positions may be vulnerable if buying momentum increases. A short squeeze occurs when traders are compelled to buy back the asset to cover their positions, amplifying price growth in the process. This makes monitoring funding rates crucial for understanding potential market behavior. XRP’s funding rates, combined with its price trends, indicate a market environment in which positioning imbalances could trigger significant movements. Observing these patterns provides insight into potential price acceleration points. Traders who track funding rate changes can gain an advantage in anticipating market responses, particularly during periods of concentrated short activity. The views expressed in this article may include the author’s personal opinions and do not represent Times Tabloid’s opinion. Readers are advised to conduct thorough research before making any investment decisions. Any action taken by the reader is strictly at their own risk. Times Tabloid is not responsible for any financial losses. Follow us on X , Facebook , Telegram , and Google News The post More Traders Are Betting Against XRP On Binance. Here’s What It Means appeared first on Times Tabloid .

title: Bitcoin Price Prediction: BTC Stuck at $89,500 – Are Korea’s Breach and UBS the Catalyst?
body: Bitcoin is trading near $89,500, locked in a tight range that reflects consolidation rather than weakness. While price action remains compressed, a series of institutional and regulatory developments this week is reshaping how the market views Bitcoin’s longer-term role. South Korea’s $48M Bitcoin Custody Breach Raises Alarms South Korean authorities are investigating the disappearance of roughly 70 bn won ($48 mn) worth of seized Bitcoin from official custody. The issue surfaced during a routine audit by the Gwangju District Prosecutors’ Office, according to local reports. Preliminary findings suggest the loss resulted from a phishing attack, after a staff member reportedly accessed a fake website, leading to leaked credentials. While details remain limited due to the ongoing investigation, the case has reignited debate around how governments store and protect confiscated digital assets. South Korean prosecutors investigate disappearance of seized Bitcoin following phishing attack Multiple Bitcoins went missing in mid-2025 after private key credentials were exposed in a phishing attack, resulting in irreversible transfers — crypto.news (@cryptodotnews) January 23, 2026 Importantly, the incident does not reflect a failure of the Bitcoin network itself. Instead, it underscores weaknesses in human processes and custody frameworks. Long term, this type of breach may push governments toward stricter crypto custody standards, ironically strengthening institutional confidence rather than weakening it. You can't make this up. "an agency worker accessed a scam website" Nearly $50M in seized Bitcoin was stolen in a phishing attack. What could have gone to a national strategic bitcoin reserve has now fallen into the hands of bad actors. As state agencies and employees work… pic.twitter.com/sga9sqJExD — Boring Security (@BoringSecurity) January 23, 2026 UBS Explores Crypto for Private Banking Clients In a separate but related signal, UBS is reportedly evaluating plans to offer cryptocurrency investing to select private banking clients, beginning with Bitcoin and Ether for wealthy Swiss customers. According to Bloomberg, the bank is assessing third-party partners to support the rollout. UBS plans to make cryptocurrency investing available for some private banking clients in what could become a significant move into digital assets for the wealth manager https://t.co/pWi6Inm9AP — Bloomberg (@business) January 23, 2026 If successful, UBS could later expand the service into the US and Asia-Pacific, aligning with similar initiatives from Morgan Stanley and JPMorgan. The move reflects growing demand among high-net-worth investors for crypto exposure through trusted, regulated institutions, rather than exchanges alone. Bitwise’s Bitcoin-Gold ETF Signals Macro Thinking Adding to the institutional theme, Bitwise Asset Management has launched the Bitwise Proficio Currency Debasement ETF (BPRO) on the NYSE. Unlike spot Bitcoin ETFs, BPRO is actively managed and blends Bitcoin, gold, precious metals, and mining equities, with at least 25% allocated to gold at all times. The fund carries a 0.96% expense ratio and targets long-term investors focused on capital preservation. By pairing Bitcoin with gold, Bitwise frames BTC as a macro hedge against currency debasement, not a speculative trade. Bitcoin Price Forecast: $89,500 Range Tightens as Breakout Pressure Builds Bitcoin is trading near $89,500, holding inside a narrowing range after a sharp rejection from the $97,000 peak earlier this month. On the 2-hour chart, price action points to compression rather than breakdown. BTC continues to defend the $87,300–$88,000 support band, an area repeatedly tested and protected by buyers. Long lower candlestick wicks around this zone suggest sellers are struggling to gain follow-through, signaling thinning supply at lower levels. Bitcoin Price Chart – Source: Tradingview From a structural view, Bitcoin remains anchored to a rising trendline that has guided price higher since the $83,800 low. While price briefly slipped below the 50-EMA and 100-EMA, it has stabilized near the 200-EMA, which is flattening instead of rolling over. This behavior typically reflects a transition phase, not a confirmed trend reversal. The broader setup resembles a descending flag within an ascending channel, a formation that often resolves in the direction of the prevailing trend. Momentum supports this outlook. RSI has rebounded from oversold levels near 30 and is now hovering around 48–50, signaling balance rather than renewed selling pressure. Recent candles show smaller bodies and reduced volatility, often seen before range expansion. If BTC dips, $87,400 remains key support. A push above $90,980 would open the path toward $92,400 and $94,250. Trade setup: Buy near $88,000–$87,500, target $94,000, stop below $85,500. Bitcoin Hyper: The Next Evolution of BTC on Solana? Bitcoin Hyper ($HYPER) is bringing a new phase to the BTC ecosystem. While BTC remains the gold standard for security, Bitcoin Hyper adds what it always lacked: Solana-level speed. The result: lightning-fast, low-cost smart contracts, decentralized apps, and even meme coin creation, all secured by Bitcoin. Audited by Consult , the project emphasizes trust and scalability as adoption builds. And momentum is already strong. The presale has surpassed $30.9 million, with tokens priced at just $0.013625 before the next increase. As Bitcoin activity climbs and demand for efficient BTC-based apps rises, Bitcoin Hyper stands out as the bridge uniting two of crypto’s biggest ecosystems. If Bitcoin built the foundation, Bitcoin Hyper could make it fast, flexible, and fun again. title: Ethereum Foundation forms expert group to address quantum computing threats
body: After years of quiet research, the Ethereum Foundation (EF) has elevated post-quantum cryptography to a top strategic priority. The move to active engineering comes as the blockchain industry confronts accelerating timelines for quantum computing threats. The non-profit organization behind the Ethereum blockchain has announced the formation of a dedicated Post Quantum (PQ) team, led by Thomas Coratger, with support from Emile, a cryptographer behind the leanVM project that forms the cryptographic cornerstone of Ethereum’s quantum defense strategy. This is coming just a few days after Coinbase established an independent advisory board on quantum computing, which includes Ethereum researcher Justin Drake, who made the announcement of the latest EF Post Quantum team. Drake wrote on X , “Today marks an inflection in the Ethereum Foundation’s long-term quantum strategy.” He stated, “Our journey began in 2019, with the “Eth3.0 Quantum Security” presentation at StarkWare Sessions. Since 2024, PQ has been central to the @leanEthereum vision. The pace of PQ engineering breakthroughs since then has been nothing short of phenomenal,” adding that after years of preparatory work, “timelines are accelerating. Time to go full PQ.” What threats await the crypto space with quantum computing? There is growing concern that quantum computers could eventually crack the elliptic curve cryptography, which most blockchain networks operate on, and this could potentially expose wallet keys and compromise billions of pounds in digital assets. While expert estimates vary widely on when such threats might materialize, ranging from as soon as 2028 to several decades away, the consensus is building that preparation cannot wait. Industry experts estimate a five to fifteen-year timeline before quantum computers could potentially break current cryptographic standards, according to research from Chainalysis . The challenge is compounded by “harvest now, decrypt later” scenarios, where adversaries could collect and store cryptographic data today to crack it once quantum computing advances enough to do that. How is the Ethereum Foundation preparing for the post-quantum phase? The EF is placing substantial resources behind its quantum resistance efforts. Drake wrote, “Today we are announcing a $1M Poseidon Prize to harden the Poseidon hash function. We are betting big on hash-based cryptography to enjoy the strongest and leanest cryptographic foundations.” He also mentioned that the prize complements another $1 million initiative called the Proximity Prize, calling on the community to check it out as well. Previously, the foundation awarded $12 million to STARKware for work on Zero-Knowledge Scalable Transparent Arguments of Knowledge (zk-STARKS), which are central to the post-quantum strategy alongside hash-based cryptography. Multi-client post-quantum consensus devnets are already operational, with participation from established teams. The coordination for that section is being managed by Will Corcoran through the weekly PQ interop calls. Antonio Sanso, a researcher at Ethereum, will lead bi-weekly All Core Devs breakout calls beginning next month to coordinate development of post-quantum transaction signatures and account abstraction features. The foundation is also leveraging artificial intelligence for cryptographic verification, with Drake noting that Alexander Hicks, who works with the EF, ran a specialized maths AI for eight hours at a $200 cost. Drake stated that the AI “one-shotted a formal proof one of the hardest lemmas in the foundations of hash-based snarks.” According to Drake, the feat is mind-blowing, and applied cryptography will never be the same as a result. A comprehensive roadmap targeting “zero loss of funds and zero downtime” during the transition will be published on pq.ethereum.org, though specific timelines remain under wraps. The foundation plans workshops with a PQ day scheduled to be held in Cannes on March 29, 2026. Drake also mentioned that the EF will be hosting a 3-day PQ event in October, and it will be attended by top experts. There is also a six-part educational video series on Ethereum’s PQ strategy that will be released by the ZKPodcast, and materials for enterprises and nation-states are being prepared by the foundation’s Enterprise Acceleration team. title: XRP Is Coiling Like a Spring. The Next Move Won’t Be Small
body: XRP has entered a decisive phase where price compression often precedes expansion . After a sharp rejection from recent highs, volatility has tightened, and the market now trades in a narrow range that reflects hesitation rather than stability. Such periods rarely persist for long, especially after strong directional moves, making the current structure one of the most important setups in recent weeks. This technical situation gained attention following an analysis shared by Xaif on X, which examined XRP’s 4-hour chart and highlighted a developing volatility coil . The post arrived as XRP struggled to reclaim lost ground, refocusing trader attention on key technical levels that could determine the next major move. Tight Consolidation After a Sharp Decline XRP pulled back aggressively from the $2.00 region and then transitioned into tight sideways movement. Price now oscillates between approximately $1.92 and $1.96, signaling a pause where buyers and sellers continue to test each other’s resolve. This behavior often reflects indecision, but it also signals that the market prepares for resolution rather than continuation of drift. $XRP is coiling like a spring the next move won’t be small. Price is compressing right at the Tenkan–Kijun zone after a sharp drop. This circled area shows tight consolidation usually where the next move gets decided. A clean break above 1.95–1.96 opens room for a relief push. https://t.co/b7ddNsb4tX pic.twitter.com/yCrvW0DKyB — Xaif Crypto| (@Xaif_Crypto) January 23, 2026 According to CoinMarketCap data, XRP currently trades near $1.91 as of report time, posting a modest 0.41% gain over the past 24 hours. Despite this uptick, price has not escaped the consolidation range , keeping volatility compressed. Ichimoku Signals a Volatility Coil Xaif’s analysis focuses on XRP compressing directly around the Ichimoku Tenkan-Sen and Kijun-Sen lines on the 4-hour timeframe. These levels often act as short-term balance zones where momentum resets. When price clusters tightly around both lines after a strong move, it typically signals stored energy rather than exhaustion. Historical Ichimoku backtests show that similar consolidation patterns frequently precede 5% to 10% directional moves once price breaks the structure. This statistical tendency adds weight to the current setup and explains why traders closely monitor this zone. We are on X, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 — TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) June 15, 2025 Levels That Will Define Direction XRP remains technically bearish while it trades below the broader downtrend line. A clean 4-hour close above the $1.95–$1.96 resistance zone would mark a short-term shift in momentum and open room for a relief rally. Such a breakout would likely attract momentum traders looking for continuation toward higher resistance levels. On the downside, strong support sits between $1.88 and $1.90. A decisive loss of that range would invalidate the consolidation thesis and expose XRP to renewed selling pressure, especially if overall market sentiment weakens. A Move Is Building, Not Fading XRP continues to compress rather than trend, a condition that historically resolves with force. While direction remains undecided, the structure suggests that the next move will arrive with speed and size. As volatility tightens further, the market approaches a point where patience gives way to momentum. Disclaimer : This content is meant to inform and should not be considered financial advice. title: UK CPS threatens Zhimin Qian's fixer with more jail time in push for $7.6M refund
body: The Crown Prosecution Service of the United Kingdom has asked the financier and fixer of convicted Chinese Bitcoin fraudster Zhimin Qian to return $7.6 million or risk extra jail time. The individual in question, Sen Hok Ling, is a Malaysian international and a known ally of the incarcerated Qian. According to the United Kingdom’s CPS, Ling is a professional money launderer who received 83.7 BTC from Qian between February and April 2024. He cashed out the Bitcoin stash in the United Arab Emirates, sending the funds to accounts based in the country and through other third-party platforms where he converted it into cash. “Ling took part in a sophisticated money laundering operation which laundered many millions of pounds from the proceeds of crime,” said Adrian Foster, Chief Crown Prosecutor of the Crown Prosecution Service Proceeds of Crime Division, in a statement. United Kingdom’s CPS orders money launderer to return stolen funds Ling was sentenced to four years and 11 months in prison last November after pleading guilty to a one-count charge of money laundering in relation to the offence. He was sentenced alongside Qian, identified as Yadi Zhang, who received 11 years and eight months following a guilty plea for two counts of money laundering offences. Prosecutors are now asking Ling to return $7.6 million from the funds that he laundered while the operation was still active. ⚖️ @CPSUK with @metpoliceuk obtained multi-million-pound Confiscation Order against convicted money launderer Seng Hok Ling https://t.co/8qveSYwPr0 pic.twitter.com/83o8LWOcDY — Crown Prosecution Service (@CPSUK) January 22, 2026 According to previous reports, Qian ran a Ponzi scheme in China between 2014 and 2017. She used a company called Lantian Gerui, mostly targeting elderly Chinese investors. The scheme was able to con more than 128,000 out of their pensions and life savings, with most of them lured under the promise of elaborate returns. The fraudsters also held big banquets and roadshows, inviting the son-in-law of Chairman Mao to an event at one point. United Kingdom Prosecutors claimed that payouts stopped in 2017, and Qian was able to convert some of her ill-gotten funds into crypto and fled the country. They claimed that she arrived in the United Kingdom with a passport under the name Yadi Zhang and set about reinventing herself. She tried to cash out the Bitcoin to purchase high-end properties in London, but was unable to do so due to know-your-customer requirements. Instead, she settled for a $21,000-a-month mansion in Hampstead Heath, London. Seized Bitcoin stash still a subject of debate After she arrived in the United Kingdom, her diary showed that she plotted to rub shoulders with European aristocracy, jotting down hopes to purchase a Swedish castle, becoming friends with a duke, and acquiring a British bank. Qian also thought about becoming Queen of Liberaland, referring to an unrecognized microstate in the Danube River where Tron founder Justin Sun is the prime minister. However, her thoughts were cut short when she was arrested in York in April 2024. United Kingdom authorities carried out a raid on her Hampstead mansion and discovered 61,000 BTC, the largest crypto seizure in the history of the United Kingdom. The seized digital asset, which is currently worth $5.4 billion, remains the subject of debate. Investors in Lantian Gerui did not pay in crypto and are estimated to have lost a combined $600 million, a fraction of the total worth of the Bitcoin seized from her. Meanwhile, civil proceedings are still ongoing to decide how the Bitcoin will be disbursed. While victims will eventually be reimbursed, the additional funds may end up in the United Kingdom Treasury. Nico Harris, CEO at digital assets recovery firm CryptoCare, mentioned that the UK’s Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 empowers authorities to seize funds from fraud even if it originates overseas. “The law allows the UK to retain such funds, typically directing them to the Treasury or law enforcement,” he said. Harris has suggested that the United Kingdom establish a strategic reserve with the funds. If you're reading this, you’re already ahead. Stay there with our newsletter .

Ethena is a stablecoin project built on Ethereum that offers USDe, a fully decentralized coin pegged to the US dollar. Unlike stablecoins such as USDC or USDT, USDe doesn’t depend on banks or centralized companies for reserves. Instead, it uses a cash-and-carry trading strategy to keep its value equal to the dollar. For investors who prioritize decentralization, USDe could be an appealing choice — especially since it currently offers staking rewards above 9%. However, critics caution that since the project is still new, it’s uncertain whether USDe’s high yields and dollar peg can remain stable during a market downturn. Based on these developments, we’ve compiled our Ethena price prediction from 2026-2032. In this article, we’ll find out “Will ENA reach $10?” and explore the factors behind ENA price prediction. title: ChatGPT Predicts Solana (SOL) Price for February 1, 2026
body: Market participants continue to assess how major altcoins could perform as the current cycle matures. Solana (SOL), often discussed alongside Ethereum in debates about network performance and user activity, remains a focal point for traders and longer-term holders. While near-term volatility persists, forward-looking expectations suggest a bullish move for early 2026. SOL currently trades at $128.27, down 1.11% from the previous day. The token has demonstrated resilience in the face of recent market pullbacks, consolidating alongside other major assets . However, it remains well below prior cycle highs. Against this backdrop, we asked ChatGPT for a direct price outlook for Solana on February 1, 2026. The AI chatbot gave a detailed response, focused on cycle timing, market structure, and Solana’s positioning within the wider digital asset ecosystem. ChatGPT’s Price Prediction for Solana (SOL) The AI’s response set a base-case target of $165, a likely range between $140 and $210. In its assessment, ChatGPT stated that “SOL above $150 by Feb 1, 2026 feels more likely than not,” positioning $165 as “a fair midpoint.” These figures place Solana meaningfully above its current price, while stopping short of calling for an extreme upside scenario . Key Factors Supporting the Solana (SOL) Forecast The rationale behind the projection centers on several factors. First is cycle timing. According to the AI, early 2026 still falls within the post-halving expansion phase, a period when altcoins have historically attracted capital. This context supports expectations for continued participation in assets like SOL. Second, the forecast emphasizes Solana’s functional role in the market. The AI notes that Solana has established itself as a high-throughput network supporting consumer-focused crypto activity, including payments, decentralized finance, and high-volume trading segments. That positioning underpins the assumption that network usage and visibility will remain strong in 2026. We are on X, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 — TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) June 15, 2025 Scenario-Based Price Targets ChatGPT further refined its price targets. In a bearish case, ChatGPT places SOL near $140, assuming a sideways market and sustained Bitcoin dominance . The base case of around $165 reflects a balanced environment where altcoin participation improves without reaching speculative excess. In a bullish scenario, the AI sees $210 or higher as achievable if capital rotation accelerates and a broader altcoin rally takes hold. ChatGPT is bullish on Solana, expecting it to rise before the start of February. If the asset can build enough momentum, it could kickstart a run toward a new all-time high . title: Farcaster to return $180M to venture backers post-Neynar acquisition
body: Merkle Manufactory-backed decentralized social protocol Farcaster has announced that it will return the $180 million it had raised from venture backers. Farcaster’s co-founder, Dan Romero, said the platform remains operational, noting that it has over 100,000 funded wallets and had 250,000 active monthly users in December. Meanwhile, Romero clarified that the news about Farcaster shutting down was just a rumor. He pointed out that the acquirer, venture-backed startup Neynar, plans to shift the company to a more developer-focused direction. Merkle Manufactory, the company behind Farcaster , started raising the $180 million it is refunding to investors in July 2022, when it received $30 million from venture capital a16z crypto. In March 2024, the company held another Paradigm-led funding round, reportedly pushing its valuation above $1 billion. Romero says the decision is five years in the making According to the Merkle co-founder, the decision to return the $180 million follows five years of development efforts and an attempt to steward investor capital responsibly. He mentioned that Merkle has raised the entire $180 million over its lifetime. Romero’s remarks prompted a response from Farcaster investor Balaji Srivasan, who confirmed that investors were receiving their funds back. Srinivasan also expressed his satisfaction over how the Farcaster team is working on the decentralized social infrastructure. Antonio Martínez, another Farcaster and Neynar investor, also backed Romero’s post on X. The early Farcaster user called the shutdown claims complete bullshit and defended Farcaster’s initial objective of establishing a permissionless social network where users control their own data. However, other Farcaster users following the conversation are unconvinced about the decision to refund the $180 million, among other issues recently plaguing the company. Specifically, they are questioning how a firm that raised $150 million in 2024 could sell to a firm that raised far less. Meanwhile, a Farcaster builder believes the company’s problems stem from its leadership and limited community input. The builder stresses that Neynar’s takeover only works if incentives and governance become more open, while other users and developers point to the difficulty of building social networks at scale. For now, the debate remains split among the crypto audience. Some see the investor refund as a rare and orderly outcome, while others view it as a very expensive experiment that falls short of expectations. Farcaster generated $2.8M in revenue over five years Farcaster’s revenue has failed to keep pace with costs, and estimates show that the company has generated approximately $2.8 million in revenue over five years despite raising $180 million. Even the Clanker acquisition, a company generating more than $50 million in fees, failed to reverse the trend. Meanwhile, Farcaster’s future now depends on whether the builder-focused model can succeed where a social network approach failed. On the other hand, Akshat Vaidya, the co-founder and managing partner at Maelstrom, believes that scaling DeFi social is brutal. “Tokens and onchain ownership are nice features, but they don’t solve the chicken-egg problem: nobody posts daily where their audience isn’t already living.” – Akshat Vaidya , Co-founder and managing partner at Maelstrom Notably, several efforts to improve the Farcaster social network failed to work out as planned until the latest Neynar acquisition was announced. Many crypto users are reportedly monitoring developments around the decentralized social project to understand what is actually happening. Lia Savillo, the head of socials at Hype, also observes that on-chain social is not dying. She noted that the next era of on-chain social platforms will be built by teams that prioritize sustainability, infra, and UX over ideology. Savillo adds that the recent moves, including the developments with Farcaster, feel like a healthy correction. According to Savillo, early on-chain socials were driven by ideals and culture. Still, now she emphasizes that long-term viability requires operators who treat it like infrastructure, not a movement. Savillo adds that these changes across decentralized social suggest that the space is growing and shifting from founder-led experimentation to teams optimized for developer speed, reliability, and scale. title: Top 3 Crypto Opportunities With 900% Upside Potential
body: Crypto cycles usually compensate those investors that place before the new utility phase, and not after. According to analysts looking at the 2-year window, 3 assets can be seen as having long-term potential, albeit due to entirely different reasons. Two of them are the firmly established foundation of the market, and the third one is a new cheap altcoin that has not reached its initial wave of usage yet. Bitcoin (BTC) The digital asset market is still anchored on Bitcoin BTC. It is trading around $89K at a market cap of about $1.78T. Bitcoin remains the primary store of value in crypto portfolios, and most institutional funds bench on BTC to position long-term. This notwithstanding its power, chart analysts indicate resistance in the range of $92K to $98K. BTC has previously tried these sectors and failed to make a break unless there is fresh demand. Having reached its valuation of some trillion dollars, analysts anticipate that the company will grow at a slower rate in 2026 and 2027. Other price estimates reveal that Bitcoin will gain by a moderate 20% to 40% in the same year. That represents a lower return profile as compared to the previous cycles. Investors who want to get a greater upside are now combining BTC with smaller assets which are yet to be fully priced. Ethereum (ETH) Ethereum ETH is used differently. It is trading at approximately $2,900 and its market cap is almost $350B. Ether leads the smart contract market, and is the primary settlement layer of the DeFi and token issuance. Adoption is still ongoing in staking, tokenization as well as rollup ecosystems. This is also true of ETH which experiences resistance at around $3,200 and at around 3,450. The breakouts are not as dramatic and slow due to the depth of liquidity. A number of 2026- 2027 Ethereum forecasts demonstrate moderate growth unless novel fee cycles or substantial institutional demand comes. ETH has remained a core position by many long-term investors. Nevertheless, the hunt of greater multiples has shifted the focus on what crypto to purchase beyond the large-cap cluster. Mutuum Finance (MUTM) Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is that new crypto type of category. It is creating a lending protocol, with collateral conditions, borrowing machinery and two live markets. One market consumes liquidity pools that provide lenders with assets and receive APY in the form of mtTokens. The other permits direct matching in loan-to-value conditions like 35% or 75%. At the start of the early distribution phase in 2025, Mutuum Finance was trading at $0.01. During Phase 7, the token is currently at $0.04. It has raised a total of $19.9M, 18,900 holders are registered and 830M tokens sold. Out of the 4B supply, 1.82B or 45.5% are early access. The participants in Phase 1 will be aligned to 500% appreciation at the pricing point at the launching official price of $0.06. The official X account of the team states that V1 protocol will be released in the Sepolia testnet in Q1 2026. Utility Mechanics and Price Modeling Analysts who monitor DeFi crypto assets indicate that the token model of Mutuum Finance is outstanding due to its connection with the usage. Part of the revenue transfers to lenders via mtTokens when borrowers pay interest. The other portion is to buy MUTM in the open market. Bought tokens are recast to the stakers of the safety module of the mtTokens. This is referred to as a buy and distribute model. Analysts believe this equates token demand to the activity of borrowing as opposed to the attention cycles. The reliability of pricing is based on correct collateral information. Mutuum Finance is a decentralized finance company where oracles are utilized to provide data to the liquidation engine. This reduces undesirable instances of liquidation in high volatility, as well as securing lenders. Within a price model based on utility, a number of analysts project MUTM to be within the $0.18 to $0.24 price range in 2027. With the current level of $0.04, it would mean an increase of 350%-500% with the conditions of healthy borrowing. Stablecoin and Layer-2 Growth An overcollateralized stablecoin is also part of the roadmap. Individuals will be able to mint a stablecoin without the necessity to sell assets. Borrowers of stablecoins are more likely to remain longer in lending ecosystems to amplify earnings predictability and result in several times greater APY to residents. Expansion of the layers (layer 2) will also be done. Layers-2 access has the potential to cut fees and enhance user experience on smaller portfolios. According to analysts, the two features widen addressable demand and enhance user retention after the protocol is active. Bitcoin’s and Ethereum’s scale restricts the potential through 2026 and 2027. Mutuum Finance comes into the picture as a future crypto competitor since it is at the first toe of its utility window. Assuming its usage form and revenue logic is realized, analysts believe that MUTM may be among the best crypto opportunities to appreciate over the next several years, with some estimating 900% upside in constructive bullish scenarios. title: Bitcoin Approaches Key Monthly Close — Here Are 3 Likely Scenarios
body: In the last week, Bitcoin suffered another correction wave with prices dropping to around $88,000 as the crypto market continues to face a weak investor appetite. While the premier cryptocurrency has experienced some slight relief, an approaching monthly close indicates the market is at a critical juncture that could define its price direction for February. Bitcoin Market Weighs Rebalance Or Complete Breakdown According to seasoned analyst KillaXBT , Bitcoin is heading into a pivotal monthly close next week, as recent price action suggests the market is approaching an inflection point. Notably, after sweeping external highs near $94,600 earlier in the month, BTC has since faced firm rejection, pushing price back toward the lower end of its recent range between $88,000-$90,000. The rejection from these highs resulted in pronounced upper wicks on higher timeframes, a structure that often signals aggressive selling pressure. However, KillaXBT explains that such wicks are frequently partially or fully retraced, due to liquidity. With a full trading week still remaining before the monthly candle closes, the market analyst postulates that there are three primary scenarios that could determine price direction for February. Firstly, Bitcoin could rise into the end of the month, allowing for a stronger monthly close. Under this scenario, February could begin with price forming the upper portion of the current wick, potentially revisiting the low-to-mid $90,000s before rolling over later in the month toward the $83,800 region. In the second scenario, Bitcoin closes the month near current levels around $89,000, followed by an early-February move to hunt liquidity in the $91,000–$92,000 range before resuming a downward trend. Interestingly, both scenarios align with the idea that the market may first move higher to rebalance liquidity before resolving lower. The third scenario presents a more severe outcome that aligns with a potential market breakdown. In this case, KillaXBT forecasts Bitcoin could retrace below the weekly and monthly open at $87,664 and close beneath this level before February. The analyst describes this scenario as “violently bearish”, as it increases the probability of a rapid move towards a lower support in the new month. Notably, KillaXBT favors the first two scenarios, as the present sentiment being heavily bearish indicates that most investors are least expecting a move to the higher side. However, the analyst also emphasizes that the loss of $83,800 support in any scenario would significantly alter the outlook for any remaining long exposure. Bitcoin Price Overview At press time, Bitcoin trades at $89,645 following a minor 1.4% gain in the last day.
